com.example.diningapp

Class Eatery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.diningapp.Eatery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Eatery>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cafe, Hall

    public abstract class Eatery
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Eatery>
    This abstract class is a superclass of both Hall and Cafe, and represents a place to eat on Cornell campus Fields are used to populate both the listView and the Eatery's corresponding activity.
    Author:
    James Stoyell

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.lang.String commonName
      The common name of the Eatery that will be shown to the user
      (package private) java.lang.String description
      The HTML formatted string description of the Eatery that will be shown to the user, generally received from the Cornell site
      (package private) double latitude
      Latitude coordinate as float
      private int LOCATION_REFRESH_DELAY
      The time to wait before refreshing the user's location if requested, in milliseconds
      (package private) int logo
      The integer reference to the logo of this Eatery, stored in the res folder
      (package private) double longitude
      Longitude coordinate as float
      (package private) java.lang.String mapsQuery
      String query used when opening google maps to get directions
      (package private) java.lang.String officialName
      Only sort of an official name - actually just a unique string that will be present in any given name that might show up in an HTML doc or other external input
      private static SharedPreferences prefs
      A reference to the user preferences
      private static long timeOfLastLocationCheck
      The time that the user location was last checked for.
      private static Location userLocation
      A location representing the last Location received from the Android OS.

      • officialName

        java.lang.String officialName
        Only sort of an official name - actually just a unique string that will be present in any given name that might show up in an HTML doc or other external input

      • timeOfLastLocationCheck

        private static long timeOfLastLocationCheck
        The time that the user location was last checked for. Unix timestamp of milliseconds since some date in 1970. Defaults to 0 to show that location has not been checked during this execution

      • userLocation

        private static Location userLocation
        A location representing the last Location received from the Android OS. Just gets most recent when updated, doesn't force a location update

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • updateUserLocation

        public static void updateUserLocation()
        Updates the location of the user using the most recently received provider. This does not force a new retrieval of the information, just grabs whichever one was retrieved most recently. If the user location cannot be found, the sort options is reset to alphabetical and a Toast is displayed to the user
